p: The most intensively reflected criteria included very different fields of action: strategies to increase and ensure the acceptance of the protected areas by the public ( 10.3; depth 0.75), managing for biomass, diversity and network (2. 4) within the protected area to maintain and enhance ecological functionality and resilience (depth 0.69), managing beyond the borders of the protected area (11. 1) into the matrix (depth 0.67) as well as managing a protected area with a continuous management scope and connecting to nearby ecosystems ( 3. 2, depth 0.67). The first three criteria were only addressed by a minority of plans (45â€“48%) but the latter one was considered by 60% of the management plans.
